item.title: 炙手可热的大宗商品市场让各国央行对通胀望而却步
item.description: 新一轮大宗商品热潮正在使央行的反通胀努力变得更加复杂，并可能使大幅降息的前景很快破灭。【原文：A new commodities boom is complicating central bankers’ anti-inflation efforts and may help derail prospects for significant interest-rate cuts any time soon.】

item.title: 听证会获悉，明星主席和前首席执行官密谋推翻监管机构
item.description: 一项调查听说，Star Entertainment Group Ltd. 的董事长和这家陷入困境的悉尼赌场运营商的前首席执行官密谋将政府任命的经理赶下台，即使该公司公开表示合作。该公司股价暴跌。【原文：Star Entertainment Group Ltd.’s chairman and the troubled Sydney casino operator’s former chief executive officer plotted to oust a government-appointed manager even as the company made public statements of cooperation, an inquiry heard. item.title: 东京电力旗舰核电站将装载福岛事故后的第一批燃料
item.description: 东京电力公司（Tokyo Electric Power Co., Ltd.）将在全球最大的柏崎刈羽核电站装载燃料，这是自 2011 年福岛核泄漏事故后实施限制措施以来的首次装载，日本将继续努力重振其原子能舰队。【原文：Tokyo Electric Power Co. will load fuel at the idled Kashiwazaki Kariwa nuclear plant, the world’s biggest, for the first time since curbs introduced following the 2011 Fukushima disaster, as Japan continues efforts to revive its atomic fleet.】

item.title: 中国私人建筑商面临 5,530 亿美元的竣工住宅缺口
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc）的一份研究报告显示，中国私营开发商在完成预售房屋方面面临着 4 万亿元人民币（合 5,530 亿美元）的资金缺口，这使得这个尚未触底反弹的行业雪上加霜。【原文：Chinese private developers face a 4 trillion yuan ($553 billion) funding gap to complete pre-sold homes, adding to the woes of an industry that has yet to bottom out, according to a research report by Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.description: 美国和英国对俄罗斯金属的制裁将巩固中国作为莫斯科关键商品最后买家的地位，并加强上海作为全球经济关键材料定价地的作用。【原文：US and UK sanctions on Russian metals will cement China as Moscow’s buyer of last resort for key commodities, and enhance Shanghai’s role as a venue to set prices for materials crucial to the global economy.】

item.title: 对俄罗斯新供应的制裁令伦敦金属交易所（LME）不安，金属价格飙升
item.description: 由于美国和英国的新制裁措施禁止交付上周五午夜之后生产的俄罗斯供应品，交易商们纷纷响应，伦敦金属交易所的铝价大幅上涨，创下历史新高。【原文：Aluminum surged by a record on the London Metal Exchange as traders responded to new US and UK sanctions that banned deliveries of Russian supplies produced after midnight on Friday.】

item.title: 大赦国际敦促尼日利亚阻止壳牌出售资产
item.description: 以大赦国际为首的民间社会团体表示，政府应阻止壳牌石油公司出售其在尼日利亚陆上石油业务的提议，以确保人权得到充分保障。【原文：Shell Plc’s proposed sale of its onshore oil business in Nigeria should be blocked by the government to ensure adequate safeguards for human rights, said civil society groups led by Amnesty International.】

item.title: 伊朗对以色列的打击刺激避险需求后黄金跳涨
item.description: 由于伊朗上周末对以色列的袭击推动了对避险资产的需求，黄金在开盘后不久就上涨了 1.2%。【原文：Gold rose as much as 1.2% shortly after the open as Iran’s attack on Israel over the weekend drove demand for haven assets.】

item.title: 伊朗袭击发生后，交易员谨慎行事：市场综述
item.description: 在亚洲早盘交易中，投资者表现谨慎，因为在伊朗周末对以色列发动前所未有的袭击后，市场正努力应对日益加剧的紧张局势。【原文：Investors are treading cautiously in early Asian trading as markets grapple with ratcheting tensions after Iran’s unprecedented attack on Israel at the weekend.】

item.title: 伊朗对以色列发动袭击后原油开盘低迷
item.description: 伊朗对以色列发动了史无前例的袭击，但由于包括美国在内的主要大国敦促保持克制，人们猜测冲突将继续得到控制，石油价格因此受到抑制。【原文：Oil shrugged off Iran’s unprecedented attack on Israel, with gains held in check by speculation that the conflict would remain contained as leading powers including the US urged restraint.】

item.title: 日本保险公司的投资计划可能会偏爱日本国债
item.description: 日本负利率结束后，日本的人寿保险公司今年可能会购买更多的国内主权债券。【原文：Japan’s life insurers are likely to buy more domestic sovereign bonds this year after the end of negative interest rates in the country.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 全球最大的铜业年度盛会之一将在圣地亚哥拉开帷幕，Cesco 周和 CRU 世界铜业大会将在工业金属的风口浪尖上展开。与此同时，一年一度的 BNEF 峰会将在纽约召开，届时项目开发商、政府官员和银行家将齐聚一堂，共同探讨能源转型的全球趋势。【原文：One of the world’s biggest annual gatherings for the copper industry kicks off in Santiago, with Cesco Week and CRU’s World Copper Conference unfolding while the industrial metal is having a moment. Meanwhile, the annual BNEF Summit will convene in New York, bringing together project developers, government officials and bankers to discuss global trends in the energy transition.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉因调查贪污逮捕石油和天然气公司官员
item.description: 在对委内瑞拉石油公司（Petroleos de Venezuela SA）损失的数十亿美元收入进行调查期间，委内瑞拉政府拘留了一名前石油部长，并于周日逮捕了两名高级能源官员。【原文：Venezuela’s government arrested two high-level energy officials on Sunday following the detention of a former oil minister amid an investigation into billions of lost Petroleos de Venezuela SA revenue.】

item.title: 受创债券交易员采取 "作秀 "模式避免更多损失
item.description: 债券投资者再次被强劲的经济数据击垮，现在他们希望在下更大的看涨赌注之前，能有明确确凿的证据证明美联储即将降息。【原文：Bond investors who were torched yet again by robust economic data now want clear and conclusive proof that Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts are imminent before making any more big bullish wagers.】

item.title: 中国高管视中美竞争为 "最大的不确定性
item.description: 中国企业高管和投资者正在迎接充满地缘政治紧张局势和经济增长放缓的未来，但同时也面临着中国房地产泡沫破灭所带来的机遇。【原文：Chinese business executives and investors are embracing a future fraught with geopolitical tensions and slowing economic growth, but also with opportunity emerging from the country’s burst real estate bubble.】

item.title: LME 俄罗斯禁令之后，金属贸易商准备好燃放烟花爆竹
item.description: 伦敦金属交易所（London Metal Exchange）针对美国和英国的新制裁措施，禁止交付周五午夜之后生产的任何俄罗斯供应品，金属交易商正准备迎接剧烈波动。【原文：Metal traders are bracing for dramatic moves after the London Metal Exchange responded to new US and UK sanctions by banning deliveries of any Russian supplies produced after midnight on Friday.】

item.title: 耶伦称中国产能过剩问题无解
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）表示，美国不会针对中国的制造能力采取 "任何行动"，包括可能征收额外关税，以阻止她所称的廉价商品涌入美国市场。【原文：Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said the US wouldn’t take “anything off the table” in response to China’s manufacturing capacity, including the possibility of additional tariffs to stem what she has described as a flood of cheap goods into the US market.】

item.title: 波兰在供过于求的情况下限制风能和太阳能发电场的产量
item.description: 由于电力供过于求，波兰周日下令削减可再生能源发电量，创下历史新高，这凸显了国家电网因更广泛地使用绿色电力而面临的日益严峻的挑战。【原文：Poland ordered record cuts for generation of renewable energy on Sunday due to electricity oversupply, highlighting growing challenges the nation’s grid faces from the wider use of green power.】

item.title: 收购巨头 CVC 在阿姆斯特丹首次公开募股中寻求超过 10 亿欧元的资金
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，CVC Capital Partners 将重启在阿姆斯特丹首次公开募股的计划，并可能寻求筹集约 10 亿欧元（11 亿美元）至 15 亿欧元的资金，这可能为其他私募股权公司上市铺平道路。【原文：CVC Capital Partners is set to revive plans for an initial public offering in Amsterdam and may seek to raise between about €1 billion ($1.1 billion) and €1.5 billion, according to people familiar with the matter, potentially paving the way for other private equity firms to go public.】
